intro: Baccaurea brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed baccaurea, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed, and it is often found growing in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Baccaurea brevipes is considered a rare and understudied species.
